---
title: "Country Analysis"
---

This page analyzes how life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population change over time for one country.

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

gap = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

country_name = "China"  # change this to any country in the dataset
c = gap[gap["country"] == country_name].sort_values("year")

fig, axes = plt.subplots(3, 1, figsize=(10, 10), constrained_layout=True)

# Life expectancy
axes[0].plot(c["year"], c["life_expectancy"], marker="o")
axes[0].set_title(f"{country_name}: Life Expectancy Over Time")
axes[0].set_xlabel("Year")
axes[0].set_ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")

# GDP per capita
axes[1].plot(c["year"], c["gdp_per_capita"], marker="o")
axes[1].set_yscale("log")
axes[1].set_title(f"{country_name}: GDP per Capita Over Time")
axes[1].set_xlabel("Year")
axes[1].set_ylabel("GDP per Capita (log scale)")

# Population
axes[2].plot(c["year"], c["population_millions"], marker="o")
axes[2].set_title(f"{country_name}: Population Over Time")
axes[2].set_xlabel("Year")
axes[2].set_ylabel("Population (millions)")

plt.show()
```
